snippet: The police’s fatal shooting on Saturday of a man wielding a kitchen knife was a grisly illustration of what many in the area believe: Times Square remains a circus, even if the actors have changed.
abstract: Fatal shooting of Darrius H Kennedy by New York City police after he threatened officers and passersby with a knife is a grisly reminder that more than 30 years after its wide-scale redevelopment began, Times Square can be a disturbing mix of tourist heaven, hustler haven and magnet for the unexpected.
lead_paragraph: The police’s fatal shooting on Saturday of a man wielding a kitchen knife was a grisly illustration of what many in the area believe: Times Square remains a circus, even if the actors have changed.

headline.seo: In the New Times Square, Still a Mix of Characters
headline.main: In the New Times Square, Still a Mix of Characters
headline.print_headline: In the New Times Square, Still a Mix of Characters
